jerk.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to move with a quick sudden movement, or to make part of your body move in this way
jerk.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Wilcox jerked his head to indicate that they should move on.
‘Is that the only way out of here?’ he asked, jerking a thumb at the door.
The sound of the phone jerked me awake.
Suddenly, he jerked back in his chair.
jerk.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to pull something suddenly and roughly
jerk.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: She jerked open the car door and got out.
Doyle jerked at the girl’s hair to make her sit down.
jerk.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: He gave a sudden jerk of his head.
She started the car with a jerk and hit the bumper of the car in front.
jerk.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: someone, especially a man, who is stupid or who does things that annoy or hurt other people
jerk.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: I swore at him for being such a jerk.
